p: A few studies report the presence of HEV in wild boars and deer in Europe and Japan [ 27, 58, 61, 81, 86, 96, 115, 120, 122, 127, 141]. The seroprevalence rates observed in wild boars are variable from 9 to 71%, and in deer from 2 to 35% (Tab. I). The prevalence of HEV RNA ranges from 3 to 25% in wild boars (Tab. I). More recently, a Hungarian study reported that approximately 34% of deer livers were positive for HEV RNA (11/32) (Tab. I).
